title: Midjourney didn’t flinch at fake Trump images, but platform abuse motivated free trial halt
description: Midjourney recently halted free trials for its image generator, but not because of the Donald Trump deepfakes circulating online.

title: New FiiO portable music player offers desktop-grade hi-res audio on the go
description: FiiO's new M15S boasts on-board Wi-Fi and dual DACs plus support for Roon and MQA, making it a step-up High-Res portable player option.

title: New outreach program urges Gen Z to come clean about its vinyl fetish
description: Vinyl records enjoy ongoing popularity, and a new outreach program from a US-based record-cleaning machine maker aims to teach younger generations about the care and feeding of LPs.

title: Watch out - that Tor browser install could just be malware
description: A clipboard-hijacking malware was seen passing off as Tor browser and stealing people’s Dogecoins.

title: Intel plans a 144-core CPU but you probably won’t be able to buy it anyway
description: Sierra Forest will bring more cores than AMD’s Bergamo but will it matter at all?

title: Marvel's Wolverine: everything we know about the PS5 exclusive so far
description: A Wolverine game is coming exclusively to PS5. Here's everything we know so far about Marvel's Wolverine.

title: Wonder Woman game: everything we know so far
description: A Wonder Woman game is confirmed to be in the works at Monolith Productions, the developer behind Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor.

title: Netflix's Scott Pilgrim TV show reunites the film's cast – and I couldn't be happier
description: Netflix's TV anime adaptation of Scott Pilgrim Vs. The World will star a number of familiar faces.

title: The White House is sending millions to countries hit by major cyberattacks
description: Costa Rica is getting $25 million to bolster its cyber defenses.

title: Foldable phones are set for some major growth
description: Over the next five years, foldable phones could have a 27.6% CAGR, analysts believe.

title: Google is making sure its ads are actually worth clicking on
description: A new Google tool to check an advertiser’s history hopes to make ads more transparent.

title: It looks like PSVR 2 probably won't outsell its predecessor
description: PSVR 2 is likely to miss its sales targets, according to a notable VR analyst.

title: Xbox vice president promises “10 more years” of support for indie devs
description: Xbox vice president affirms the company’s commitment to the ID@Xbox program for years to come.

title: The FDA now requires medical devices be secured against cyberattacks
description: Critical vulnerabilities in Internet-connected medical devices lead to new FDA cybersecurity protection measures.

title: HBO Max's streaming successor will be revealed very soon
description: Warner Bros. Discovery announces when it'll officially unveil its new super streamer, which will replace HBO Max and Discovery Plus.

title: Google - these serious security threats are targeting both Android and iOS devices
description: Exploits and techniques are being shared between surveillance vendors, Google believes.

title: ChatGPT in your pocket: Palm-sized external Nvidia GPU weighs only 250g - but who will use it?
description: Portable GPU is an ultra-portable accelerator in search of a market.

title: Google denies that Bard AI copied ChatGPT’s homework
description: A Google spokesperson has set the record straight – no data was scraped from ChatGPT.

title: Microsoft Teams wants to help you beat this super time-consuming task
description: New chat dashboard will save you hunting through reams of Microsoft Teams text.

title: Netflix Games could be coming to your TV, and I can’t believe I'm excited about it
description: Netflix's gaming service looks set to launch on its TV app, and I'm surprised to say I can't wait for the update.

title: Many businesses still aren't making hybrid work secure enough
description: Most business leaders are wary of hybrid workers being compromised and giving away sensitive information.

title: Don't miss one of the best PS5 games coming to PS Plus next week
description: Sackboy: A Big Adventure, and two other top-tier PS5 games, are coming to PlayStation Plus in April.

title: Got an iPhone and a Fitbit? You may need to update your phone
description: Fitbit has quietly updated its restrictions for iPhone users, and the app will now only work with iOS 15 and newer.

title: OnePlus Nord 3 certifications point to an impending launch and speedy charging
description: The OnePlus Nord 3 could offer 80W charging, and its presence on certification sites suggests it might launch soon.

title: Nvidia RTX 4050 and 4060 Ti GPUs are great news for us, bad news for AMD
description: Nvidia could release a range of GPUs that will finally make RTX 4000 tech more accessible.

title: A VoIP service used by some of the world's biggest firms has been hacked
description: A trojanized version of 3CX VoIP desktop app is capable of stealing data from browsers, researchers claim.

title: Chatbot or adbot? Microsoft could bring adverts to ChatGPT-powered Bing AI
description: Microsoft appears hellbent on cramming adverts into everything, and people are going to get sick of this.

title: HP's new laser printers are its greenest and most efficient yet
description: Laser printing has come under scrutiny for high energy usage - has HP managed to make its printers more green?

title: The Night Agent season 2 is on the way – and I'm not surprised
description: Netflix has renewed the smash-hit spy thriller series for a second season just one week after release.

title: The new Microsoft Surface Hub 2S wants to make your Teams calls more immersive than ever
description: The next Microsoft Surface Hub 2S looks to focus on software rather than hardware, which is a good thing.

title: Exclusive: OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite chipset, screen specs, and software confirmed
description: OnePlus' Kinder Liu confirms details about key OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite specs exclusively with us.

title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Thursday, March 30 (game #430)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Calm down folks, ChatGPT isn't actually an artificial intelligence
description: ChatGPT is a revolutionary technology for sure, but despite its impressive capabilities, it's still just a ChatBot, and it is far from actually being intelligent.
